tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from Schenker to Pairamall, dated November 12, 1913

tei:transcription.tei:p: Frau [/] Evelina Pairamall [rest of address all crossed out:] Hauptpostlagernd Berlin, W. Hotel Cumberland Kurfürstendamm Deutschland

[postmark (twice):] || 10/2 WIEN 77 | 12.XI.13-12 | 5c ||
{envelope verso} Dr H Schenker III Reisnerstr. 38 Wien [stamped:] Postbüro [twice] [stamped, inverted:] Nicht abgefordert [/] Postlagerstelle des Briefpostamts [stamped, inverted, in circle:] O.2. | a

Meinen herzlichsten Dank für die liebenswürdige Zusendung des S. Saëns-Artikels, der mich sehr interessiert hat. On the same day, November 12, 1913, S recorded the present letter of thanks, describing the item received from Mrs. P. as “the November issue of SJM in which Saint-Saëns reports on the Ninth Symphony on the basis of the autograph” (OJ 1/11, p. 468). Auch ich mache augenblicklich dankbar schönste Erfahrungen mit einem 2, “2.”: double-underlined. aus Frankfurt a/M. mir zugekommenen Autograph ad op. 110. On November 4, 1913, S recorded in his diary “Announcement [of the forthcoming arrival] of the second autograph from Frankfurt” (OJ 1/11, p. 462). This autograph, which was in the collection of Louis Koch and is now in the Beethovenhaus, Bonn, includes the Adagio, Arioso dolente, and Fugue of Op. 110. Vielleicht entschließt sich die „U.E.“ zur Herausgabe der „IX Sinf.“ auf Grun[de] des Autographs. First talk of an edition of the score of Beethoven’s Ninth Symphony to accompany S’s monograph occurred on June 21, 1911 (WSLB 77), after which discussion continued over the following year, and Hertzka negotiated the adoption of the plates of the Eulenburg edition; but when in 1913 it became clear to UE that S intended to modify that edition according to the readings in the autograph manuscript (OC 52/440, December 12, 1913; OC 52/138, January 5, 1914; WSLB 199, January 7, 1914) , the plan was eventually dropped. So billig die Hausphotographie der Kgl. Bibliothek in Berlin arbeitet, wür[de] es mir doch willkommen, die „U.E.“ die Kosten der Photographie tragen zu lassen. S addressed the cost of the photography in a letter to Hertzka of the same day as the present letter (WSLB 192).
Nicht wahr, Sie kommen bald? Denn sollen Sie meine jüngsten Schätze an {2} Autographen u. Skizzen bewundern u. noch mehr die Resultate genießen, die ^aber^ erst sie eröffnet haben.
Verzeihen Sie alle Hast, aber ich werde derart von „Gegenstimmen“ contrapunktiert, daß ich nicht die Gelassenheit einer cantus-firmus-note aufbringen kann. Dieser Vergleich hinkt durchaus nicht.
Auf Wiedersehen! Beste Grüße Ihr erg[e]b[ener] [signed:] H Schenker 12.XI.1913

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from Schenker to Pairamall, dated November 12, 1913

tei:translation.tei:p: Mrs. [/] Evelina Pairamall [rest of address all crossed out:] Poste restante Berlin, W. Hotel Cumberland Kurfürstendamm Germany

[postmark (twice):] || 10/2 WIEN 77 | 12.XI.13-12 | 5c ||
{envelope verso} Dr. H. Schenker, Vienna III, Reisnerstraße 38 [stamped:] Post Office [twice] [stamped, inverted:] Not returned to sender [/] Poste restante counter of the letter post office [stamped, inverted, in circle:] O.2. | a

My most sincere thanks for your having kindly sent the Saint Saëns article, which has very much interested me. At the moment I am also thankfully having a most delightful time working on a second| autograph of Op. 110, which has just reached me from Frankfurt. Perhaps UE will decide to publish the Ninth Symphony on the basis of the autograph. No matter how cheap the in-house photography of the Royal Library in Berlin works out, I should be glad if UE would bear the cost of the photography.
You are arriving soon, aren’t you? Then you should admire my latest treasures of {2} autographs and sketches, and enjoy even more the results that they have only just revealed.
Excuse me for all of the hurry, but I have become so counterpointed by “counter melodies” that I cannot muster the composure of a cantus-firmus note. This is absolutely not a lame comparison.
Goodbye! Best wishes, Your devoted, [signed:] H Schenker December 12, 1913
